trans-unit.source: Enable offline sync for your Azure Mobile App (Xamarin Android)
trans-unit.target: Enable offline sync for your Azure Mobile App (Xamarin Android)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use App Service Mobile App to cache and sync offline data in your Xamarin Android application
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use App Service Mobile App to cache and sync offline data in your Xamarin Android application

trans-unit.source: This tutorial introduces the offline sync feature of Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Android.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial introduces the offline sync feature of Azure Mobile Apps for Xamarin.Android.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app--viewing, adding, or modifying data--even when there is no network connection.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app--viewing, adding, or modifying data--even when there is no network connection.

trans-unit.source: Changes are stored in a local database; once the device is back online, these changes are synced with the remote service.
trans-unit.target: Changes are stored in a local database; once the device is back online, these changes are synced with the remote service.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will update the client project from the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app] to support the offline features of Azure Mobile Apps.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will update the client project from the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app] to support the offline features of Azure Mobile Apps.

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the data access extension packages to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the data access extension packages to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see <linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see <linkText>Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the offline sync feature, see the topic [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the offline sync feature, see the topic [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio [Xamarin extension] or [Xamarin Studio]
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio [Xamarin extension] or [Xamarin Studio]

trans-unit.source: Completion of the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app].
trans-unit.target: Completion of the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app].

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses the completed app covered in that tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses the completed app covered in that tutorial.

trans-unit.source: The Xamarin client project that you downloaded when you completed the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app] already contains code supporting offline synchronization using a local SQLite database.
trans-unit.target: The Xamarin client project that you downloaded when you completed the tutorial [Create a Xamarin Android app] already contains code supporting offline synchronization using a local SQLite database.

trans-unit.source: Here is a brief overview of what is already included in the tutorial code.
trans-unit.target: Here is a brief overview of what is already included in the tutorial code.

trans-unit.source: For a conceptual overview of the feature, see [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: For a conceptual overview of the feature, see [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: Before any table operations can be performed, the local store must be initialized.
trans-unit.target: Before any table operations can be performed, the local store must be initialized.

trans-unit.source: The local store database is initialized when ToDoActivity.OnCreate() executes ToDoActivity.InitLocalStoreAsync().
trans-unit.target: The local store database is initialized when ToDoActivity.OnCreate() executes ToDoActivity.InitLocalStoreAsync().

trans-unit.source: This creates a new local SQLite database using the MobileServiceSQLiteStore class provided by the Azure Mobile Apps client SDK.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new local SQLite database using the MobileServiceSQLiteStore class provided by the Azure Mobile Apps client SDK.

trans-unit.source: The DefineTable method creates a table in the local store that matches the fields in the provided type, ToDoItem in this case.
trans-unit.target: The DefineTable method creates a table in the local store that matches the fields in the provided type, ToDoItem in this case.

trans-unit.source: The type doesn't have to include all of the columns that are in the remote database.
trans-unit.target: The type doesn't have to include all of the columns that are in the remote database.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to store just a subset of columns.
trans-unit.target: It is possible to store just a subset of columns.

trans-unit.source: // ToDoActivity.cs
trans-unit.target: // ToDoActivity.cs

trans-unit.source: The toDoTable member of ToDoActivity is of the IMobileServiceSyncTable type instead of IMobileServiceTable.
trans-unit.target: The toDoTable member of ToDoActivity is of the IMobileServiceSyncTable type instead of IMobileServiceTable.

trans-unit.source: This directs all create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) table operations to the local store database.
trans-unit.target: This directs all create, read, update, and delete (CRUD) table operations to the local store database.

trans-unit.source: You decide when those changes are pushed up to the Azure Mobile App backend by calling IMobileServiceSyncContext.PushAsync() using the sync context for the client connection.
trans-unit.target: You decide when those changes are pushed up to the Azure Mobile App backend by calling IMobileServiceSyncContext.PushAsync() using the sync context for the client connection.

trans-unit.source: The sync context helps preserve table relationships by tracking and pushing changes in all tables a client app has modified when PushAsync is called.
trans-unit.target: The sync context helps preserve table relationships by tracking and pushing changes in all tables a client app has modified when PushAsync is called.

trans-unit.source: The provided code calls ToDoActivity.SyncAsync() to sync whenever the todoitem list is refreshed or a todoitem is added or completed.
trans-unit.target: The provided code calls ToDoActivity.SyncAsync() to sync whenever the todoitem list is refreshed or a todoitem is added or completed.

trans-unit.source: So it syncs after every local change executing a push on the sync context and a pull on the sync table.
trans-unit.target: So it syncs after every local change executing a push on the sync context and a pull on the sync table.

trans-unit.source: However, it is important to realize that if a pull is executed against a table that has pending local updates tracked by the context, that pull operation will automatically trigger a context push first.
trans-unit.target: However, it is important to realize that if a pull is executed against a table that has pending local updates tracked by the context, that pull operation will automatically trigger a context push first.

trans-unit.source: So in these cases (refresh, adding and completing items) you could omit the explicit PushAsync call.
trans-unit.target: So in these cases (refresh, adding and completing items) you could omit the explicit PushAsync call.

trans-unit.source: It is redundant.
trans-unit.target: It is redundant.

trans-unit.source: In the provided code, all records in the remote TodoItem table are queried, but it is also possible to filter records by passing a query id and query to PushAsync.
trans-unit.target: In the provided code, all records in the remote TodoItem table are queried, but it is also possible to filter records by passing a query id and query to PushAsync.

trans-unit.source: For more information see the section Incremental Sync in [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: For more information see the section Incremental Sync in [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: Run the client application at least once to to populate the local store database.
trans-unit.target: Run the client application at least once to to populate the local store database.

trans-unit.source: In the next section, you will simulate an offline scenario and modify the data in the local store while the app is offline.
trans-unit.target: In the next section, you will simulate an offline scenario and modify the data in the local store while the app is offline.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will modify the client app to simulate an offline scenario by using an invalid application URL for your backend.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will modify the client app to simulate an offline scenario by using an invalid application URL for your backend.

trans-unit.source: When you add or change data items, these changes will be held in the local store, but not synced to the backend data store until the connection is re-established.
trans-unit.target: When you add or change data items, these changes will be held in the local store, but not synced to the backend data store until the connection is re-established.

trans-unit.source: At the top of ToDoActivity.cs, change the initialization of applicationURL and gatewayURL to point to invalid URLs:
trans-unit.target: At the top of ToDoActivity.cs, change the initialization of applicationURL and gatewayURL to point to invalid URLs:

trans-unit.source: Update ToDoActivity.SyncAsync so that MobileServicePushFailedException are caught and simply ignored assuming you are offline.
trans-unit.target: Update ToDoActivity.SyncAsync so that MobileServicePushFailedException are caught and simply ignored assuming you are offline.

trans-unit.source: Build and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Build and run the app.

trans-unit.source: If you get an exception dialog reporting name resolution exception close it.
trans-unit.target: If you get an exception dialog reporting name resolution exception close it.

trans-unit.source: Add some new todo items and notice the app behaves as if it is connected because MobileServicePushFailedException is handled without displaying the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Add some new todo items and notice the app behaves as if it is connected because MobileServicePushFailedException is handled without displaying the dialog.

trans-unit.source: The new items you add exist only in the local store until they can be pushed to the mobile backend.
trans-unit.target: The new items you add exist only in the local store until they can be pushed to the mobile backend.

trans-unit.source: Close the app and restart it to verify that the new items you created are persisted to the local store.
trans-unit.target: Close the app and restart it to verify that the new items you created are persisted to the local store.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Use Visual Studio to view your Azure SQL Database table to see that the data in the backend database has not changed.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Use Visual Studio to view your Azure SQL Database table to see that the data in the backend database has not changed.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your database in Azure->SQL Databases.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your database in Azure->SQL Databases.

trans-unit.source: Right-click your database and select Open in SQL Server Object Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Right-click your database and select Open in SQL Server Object Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Now you can browse to your SQL database table and its contents.
trans-unit.target: Now you can browse to your SQL database table and its contents.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Use a REST tool such as Fiddler or Postman to query your mobile backend, using a GET query in the form https://your-mobile-app-backend-name.azurewebsites.net/tables/TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Use a REST tool such as Fiddler or Postman to query your mobile backend, using a GET query in the form https://your-mobile-app-backend-name.azurewebsites.net/tables/TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will reconnect the app to the mobile backend, which simulates the app coming back to an online state.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will reconnect the app to the mobile backend, which simulates the app coming back to an online state.

trans-unit.source: When you perform the refresh gesture, data will be synced to your mobile backend.
trans-unit.target: When you perform the refresh gesture, data will be synced to your mobile backend.

trans-unit.source: Open ToDoActivity.cs.
trans-unit.target: Open ToDoActivity.cs.

trans-unit.source: Correct the applicationURL and gatewayURL to point to the correct URLs.
trans-unit.target: Correct the applicationURL and gatewayURL to point to the correct URLs.

trans-unit.source: Rebuild and run the app.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild and run the app.

trans-unit.source: The app attempts to sync with the Azure Mobile App backend after launching.
trans-unit.target: The app attempts to sync with the Azure Mobile App backend after launching.

trans-unit.source: Verify no exception dialogs are created.
trans-unit.target: Verify no exception dialogs are created.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) View the updated data using either SQL Server Object Explorer or a REST tool like Fiddler.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) View the updated data using either SQL Server Object Explorer or a REST tool like Fiddler.

trans-unit.source: Notice the data has been synchronized between the Azure Mobile App backend database and the local store.
trans-unit.target: Notice the data has been synchronized between the Azure Mobile App backend database and the local store.

trans-unit.source: Notice the data has been synchronized between the database and the local store and contains the items you added while in an offline situation.
trans-unit.target: Notice the data has been synchronized between the database and the local store and contains the items you added while in an offline situation.

trans-unit.source: [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps]
trans-unit.target: [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps]

trans-unit.source: [Cloud Cover: Offline Sync in Azure Mobile Services] \(note: the video is on Mobile Services, but offline sync works in a similar way in Azure Mobile Apps\)
trans-unit.target: [Cloud Cover: Offline Sync in Azure Mobile Services] \(note: the video is on Mobile Services, but offline sync works in a similar way in Azure Mobile Apps\)
